frame.name: FR_Giving_money
frame.definition:
<def-root>
This frame involves a <fen>Giver</fen> giving <fen>Money</fen> to a <fen>Recipient</fen> or on a <fen>Repository</fen>.
<ex></ex> Distinctions with other frames: <ex></ex>
≠ <frframe>Commerce_pay</frframe> : in the latter, the LUs contain necessarily the idea of payment in exchange of some sort. In FR_Giving_money, the exchange is possible but not mandatory.
<ex></ex> ≠ <frframe>FR_Spending</frframe> : in the latter, the <fen>Recipient</fen> cannot be locally expressed.
<ex></ex>
<asf>Relation to fndata-1.5</asf> : New in ASFALDA. </def-root>

FE.name: Giver
FE.definition: <def-root>The Giver begins in possession of the <fen>Money</fen>and causes it to be in the possession of the <fen>Recipient</fen></def-root>

FE.name: Money
FE.definition: <def-root>Money is the thing given to the <fen>Recipient</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Recipient
FE.definition: <def-root>The entity that ends up in possession of the <fen>Money</fen> (CoreSet with Repository).</def-root>

FE.name: Repository
FE.definition: <def-root>The physical entity (typically a bank account) onto which the money is deposited (CoreSet with Recipient). <ex>He <t>deposited</t> 20 euros on <fex name="Repository">his account</fex> .</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Goods
FE.definition: <def-root>The FE Goods is anything (including labor or time, for example) which is exchanged for Money in a transaction. <ex>Kim <t>paid</t> fifty dollars <fex name="Gds">for the shirt</fex></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Rate
FE.definition: <def-root>In some cases, price or payment is described per unit of Goods. <ex>The manager <t>pays</t> the paper boys <fex name="Rate">five dollars an hour</fex>. </ex></def-root>
